messages.title: Watford Matters because...
messages.content: We're publishing our detailed plans for building a better future. Our contract with you makes clear commitments that we will be held to if we take office.

messages.title: THREE RIVERS EDITION
messages.content: Paid for and at no cost to the taxpayer by volunteers in Watford, Abbots Langley, Leavesden, Oxhey, Carpenders Park and Oxhey Hall.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Act now on debt to get the economy moving.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Deal with the deficit more quickly than Labour for lower mortgage rates by showing the world that the Conservatives.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Get Britain working by boosting enterprise.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut corporation tax rates, take nine out of ten of the poorest pensioners out of tax, and give people, green and new businesses, control again.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Freeze council tax and raise the basic state pension, recognising marriage in the tax system and support couples in the benefits system, back young families with extra health visitors, and fight back against criminals.
Increase spending on health every year, and make the NHS work for patients not managers.
Give teachers the power to restore discipline, and create new smaller schools.

mentions.candidate: Richard Harrington, Local Prospective MP, Conservative
mentions.tacticalSituation: Watford is one of the most marginal constituencies in the country, so how people vote here really will help to decide whether David Cameron or Gordon Brown is Prime Minister for the next five years. At the 1951 General Election the Watford result foreshadowed the country's result.

issues.economy: Deal with the deficit more quickly than Labour for lower mortgage rates by showing the world that the Conservatives.
issues.education: Give teachers the power to restore discipline, and create new smaller schools.
issues.governance: Freeze council tax and raise the basic state pension, recognising marriage in the tax system and support couples in the benefits system, back young families with extra health visitors, and fight back against criminals.
issues.health: Increase spending on health every year, and make the NHS work for patients not managers.
issues.socialWelfare: Take nine out of ten of the poorest pensioners out of tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have now lived and worked every adult year of my life in Watford...

politicalExperience.achievements: Working in the community and with local businesses to understand and address local issues.

endorsements.endorsement: We need leaders who will listen to people. Only Conservative candidates can take the place in parliament providing pragmatic solutions not ideological public meetings.

images.caption: Richard Harrington engaging with a constituent.
Graph showing historical election results in Watford.
Watford's voters will decide Britain's future.
